page.title: 07Oak Apple Day.Wishford.
page.content: On Wednesday 29th May Oak Apple Day is celebrated in Wishford.The villagers protect their rights which originally were collecting firewood from Grovely woods,grazing animals and receiving half a buck.These rights were written down in a Charter in 1603,but have existed from "time out of mind".Only one right is now used this is collecting firewood. Early in the morning oak boughs are cut and the largest hung from the church tower.Then the Charter is read in Salisbury Cathedral and four ladies dance outside.The Oak Apple Club lunch is followed by a procession through the village carrying oak boughs and a banner saying" Grovely, Grovely,Grovely,and all Grovely.Unity is strength".After this a fete is held in the Oak Apple Field.
